intro: Micropholis porphyrocarpa, commonly known as the purple-fruited micropholis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, glossy leaves and clusters of red or purple berries that are typically harvested for their medicinal properties. The bark and leaves contain compounds with potential anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial effects. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests.
